Clearance

So I'm going all Dave Ramsey and selling a bunch of stuff I no longer use. Be awesome and buy something. Just contact me or click an item title to see it on Craig's List.

  • Gretsch G5120 Electromatic Hollowbody Electric Guitar with hard case - $500

    This guitar is in excellent condition. It is $699 new without a case. This is the guitar and case for $500.

    There a few very minor scratches on the back. You have to look very closely to see them. I noticed the intonation is a bit off. I'm sure if you got it setup, it would be just fine. Everything else, including the Bigsby, works great.

  • Asus EEE PC 1000 - 1.6GHz, 2GB RAM, 40GB SSD 10" screen, Linux - $250

    Excellent condition.

    Works great, I just don't use it that much. It originally had 1GB of RAM in it, but was upgraded to 2GB. The original 1GB stick is included. Currently it has a fresh install of Jolicloud on it.

    Box, case, manual, discs, power supply, and screen cleaner included. External Samsung optical drive with cable also included.

  • Allen&Heath MixWizard WZ3 16:2 - $800

    This mixer is in excellent condition. I kept it racked in my road case for a few months and only used it a couple of times. I am selling it because I moved to a different town, so I'm no longer playing with a band. Everything works to my knowledge. I never had any issues with it.

    You can find more about it on Allen&Heath's website.

    Power cable included.

  • M-Audio Oxygen 8 V2 USB Midi Controller - $80

    This little midi controller has been great. I've mainly used it with Logic and Garageband, but I know it works with tons of different programs.

    Nothing is wrong with it. It's in pretty good condition. There are a few minor scratches on it.

    USB cable included.

  • Ernie Ball VP Jr Volume Pedal - $60

    This volume pedal has been awesome. I don't play guitar much any more, so I'm selling it. It has been really solid. Nothing is wrong with it to my knowledge.

  • Dunlop Cry Baby Wah Pedal - $40

    I bought this off a buddy and never used it. It's a little banged up, but it works. I don't have a power supply for it. Just the pedal is for sale.

  • Fender Princeton 65 Guitar Amp - $75

    This amp has been a great little practice amp for a long time. I don't really use it any more, so I'm selling it.

    If you use the first input, it buzzes real bad, so I always only use the second input. If you turn up the reverb at all, it also buzzes a bit, so I always leave it off. Besides those two things, it works great.

    The footswitch I've used with it forever has two buttons on it. This amp only supports one, so one of them doesn't do anything, but it's never caused a problem for me.

    65 watts. Solid state. Footswitch and power cable included.

  • Antique "Viva La Vida"ish Bell - $50

    I bought this bell at an antique shop in Louisville, KY awhile back because my band was covering Viva La Vida. It worked out great. It's an old dinner bell from a plantation.

    I haven't used it in a long time. It's great if you want an old bell.
